Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] New Visual Studio Update Crash Android" (#3178) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
App crashes after vs 2019 16.1.2 update
### Steps to Reproduce
Passing a binding context to a view

### Expected Behavior
App doesn't crash
### Actual Behavior
App crashes with SIGSEGV 
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 16.1.2
- Last known good version: 16.1
- Platform Target Frameworks:  Android 9

- Affected Devices: Samsung note 9

=================================================================
	Native Crash Reporting
=================================================================
Got a SIGSEGV while executing native code. This usually indicates
a fatal error in the mono runtime or one of the native libraries 
used by your application.
=================================================================

=================================================================
	Basic Fault Adddress Reporting
=================================================================

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[UWP] "FormsCheckBoxStyle.xbf" error thrown on build when using CheckBox" (#6501) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
As of the 4.2.0.504833-nightly build, attempting to use a `CheckBox` on UWP results in an error as follows:

`Payload file '[...]\.nuget\packages\xamarin.forms\4.2.0.504833-nightly\lib\uap10.0\Xamarin.Forms.Platform.UAP\FormsCheckBoxStyle.xbf' does not exist.	`

Thanks to @pierceboggan for bringing this to attention

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new XF project
2. Attempt to put a `CheckBox` onto the MainPage
3. Build/Run the app on UWP

### Expected Behavior
App builds and runs.

### Actual Behavior
Above error is reported.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.2.0.504833-nightly
- IDE: VS2019
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - UWP:  1803

### Screenshots

### Reproduction Link

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] SearchHandler.ItemsSource does not listen to INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged event" (#6500) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Opened issue "[Bug] Shell - First page in AppShell ignores the UseSafeAreaInset flag" (#6499) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

Shell does not seem to respect the `UseSafeAreaInset` flag and overrides the `Padding` of the first `ContentPage` in a tab or flyout.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the sample project below
2. See the `ContentPage`'s light purple background above and below the lavendar `StackLayout`.
3. Click on the "Next Screen" button
4. See the the second screen does not show the `ContentPage`'s background.  You can only see the `StackLayout`'s background color.

### Expected Behavior

The `ContentPage`'s content should take up the whole screen.  In the example, `StackLayout` should take up the whole screen.

### Actual Behavior

The `ContentPage` has `Padding` set to the `SafeAreaInset` values.  This means that the content inside the page does not take up the whole screen.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.0.482894
- Last known good version: N/A
- IDE: Visual Studio 2019 for Windows 16.1.2
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  12.10.0.153
  - Android: N/A
  - UWP:  N/A
- Android Support Library Version: N/A
- Nuget Packages: Just what comes with the template
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots

![2019-06-11_03-30-41-PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/991351/59304464-eeef0600-8c5d-11e9-97dc-2b3a0563e51e.png)
![2019-06-11_03-30-44-PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/991351/59304469-f0b8c980-8c5d-11e9-9fb5-a28b638f6643.png)

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/seansparkman/ShellNavigationExample/tree/use-safe-area-ignored
https://github.com/seansparkman/ShellNavigationExample/blob/use-safe-area-ignored/ShellNavigationRegistration/ShellNavigationRegistration/Views/OnBoarding.xaml#L13

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] MasterDetailPage MasterBehavior override does not work." (#6498) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
MasterDetailPage.MasterBehavior = MasterBehavior.Popover does not work on iOS. On Android phones, the Detail page is dimmed and the menu covers the page. On iOS, regardless of how MasterBehavior is set, iOS always uses a slide-over animation that's messy and gross because it's hard to tell where the Master ends and the Detail begins. None of the overrides seem to work correctly on iOS, for that matter. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download the attached sample project. It's just the Xamarin.Forms sample MasterDetail template with one minor change. 
2. Note that MasterBehavior is set to Popover in the MainPage.xaml file
3. Run it on iOS
4. Open the hamburger menu
5. The Detail slides over instead of hte menu popping over.

### Expected Behavior
That the Detail would dim and the Master would slide out (pop over it)

### Actual Behavior
The Detail slides over and the menu doesn't dim. The Menu page slides out and it's hard to tell where the Menu ends and the Detail begins. 

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.latest
- Last known good version: N/A
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 15.9.12 (also happens on VS 2019 Mac)
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  Default (12, I think)
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages: Only Xamarin.Forms and Xamarin.iOS (and dependencies)
- Affected Devices: iPhone
[MasterDetailExample.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3278385/MasterDetailExample.zip)
![iOS Simulator](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/991752/59303326-9454aa80-8c5b-11e9-878d-c09453c24e37.png)
![visual studio](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/991752/59303327-9454aa80-8c5b-11e9-8334-1de63e8474c2.png)




### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->
